note.text:
Allergies

  • Allergies and Other Adverse Reactions:

    Patient allergic to:

    1. Paracetamol

    2. Peanut

Reason for Care

  • Hospital Admission Diagnosis:
    1. RLL pneumonia
    2. COPD exacerbation

  • History of Present Illness

    72 year old thin white male presented to emergency on 8 JAN 14 with shortness of breath, weakness and dehydration. Chest X-ray showed right lower lobe infiltrate, ABGs unremarkable. Pulse ox on RA was 79%25.

    1. Pneumonia: treated with ceftriaxone and azithromycin iv. Switched to PO after 72 hours. 
    2. Exacerbation of COPD: patient treated with inhaled and oral steroids, O2 at 2l/nc. On RA at time of discharge 
    3. Weakness and dehydration: secondary to pneumonia and COPD. Responded well to strengthening with PT and regular meals. 

Other Condition Histories

  • Active Problems:
    1. RLL pneumonia
    2. COPD exacerbation
    3. mild CHF
    4. osteoarthritis
  • Discharge Diagnosis:
    1. RLL pneumonia
    2. COPD exacerbation
    3. mild CHF
    4. osteoarthritis
  • Resolved Problems: none
  • List of Surgeries:
    1. Craniotomy
    2. Lumbar Puncture

Medication

  • Medications: Zithromycin daily until gone, inhalers #of puffs
